trans-unit.source: Represents a key identifier clause that identifies a security tokens specified in the security header of the SOAP message.
Typically, the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.LocalIdKeyIdentifierClause> does not need to be used, other than when a custom security token service is created.

When a security token service returns a security token, the issued security token contains references to attached and unattached security tokens Attached references refer to security tokens that are contained within the security header of the SOAP message and unattached references are security tokens that are not included within the security header of the SOAP message.
These references typically affirm the authenticity of the issued security token.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.LocalIdKeyIdentifierClause> key identifier is placed within an `<SecurityTokenReference>` element.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.LocalIdKeyIdentifierClause"></xref> class using the specified identifier and array of types.
The value of the `wsu:Id` attribute for an XML element within the current SOAP message.
Sets the value of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.LocalIdKeyIdentifierClause.LocalId"></xref> property.
localId is `null`.
localId is empty.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.LocalIdKeyIdentifierClause"></xref> class using the specified identifier an owner security token type.
The value of the `wsu:Id` attribute for an XML element within the current SOAP message.
Sets the value of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.LocalIdKeyIdentifierClause.LocalId"></xref> property.
A that is the type of security token that is referred to by the localId parameter.
Sets the value of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.LocalIdKeyIdentifierClause.OwnerType"></xref> property.
localId is `null`.
localId is empty.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.LocalIdKeyIdentifierClause"></xref> class using the specified identifier, nonce, derived key length an owner security token type.
[!INCLUDE[vsindigo](~/includes/vsindigo-md.md)] does not support the creation of implied derived key identifiers.
However, [!INCLUDE[vsindigo](~/includes/vsindigo-md.md)] will process and consume an incoming SOAP message with implied derived key identifiers.
The value of the `wsu:Id` attribute for an XML element within the current SOAP message.
Sets the value of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.LocalIdKeyIdentifierClause.LocalId"></xref> property.
An array of <xref href="System.Byte"></xref> that contains the nonce that was used to create a derived key.
Sets the value that is returned by the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifierClause.GetDerivationNonce"></xref> method.
The size of the derived key.
Sets the value of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifierClause.DerivationLength"></xref> property.
A that is the type of security token that is referred to by the localId parameter.
Sets the value of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.LocalIdKeyIdentifierClause.OwnerType"></xref> property.
localId is `null`.
localId is empty.
Gets the value of the `wsu:Id` attribute for an XML element within the current SOAP message.
The value of the `wsu:Id` attribute for an XML element within the current SOAP message.
Returns a value that indicates whether the key identifier for this instance is equivalent to the specified key identifier clause.
A match on the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.LocalIdKeyIdentifierClause.OwnerType%2A> property occurs when one of the following happens:
The value of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.LocalIdKeyIdentifierClause.OwnerType%2A> property for the instance represented by the `keyIdentifierClause` parameter is `null`.
The value of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.LocalIdKeyIdentifierClause.OwnerType%2A> property for the current instance is `null`.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.LocalIdKeyIdentifierClause.OwnerType%2A> property for the two instances are identical.
`true` if clause is of type and the values of the and properties match the current instance; otherwise, `false`.
See the remarks for more details.
Returns a value that indicates whether the key identifier for this instance is equivalent to the specified reference and type.
A match on the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.LocalIdKeyIdentifierClause.OwnerType%2A> property occurs when one of the following happens:
The value of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.LocalIdKeyIdentifierClause.OwnerType%2A> propertyfor the current instance is `null`.
The value of the `ownerType` parameter is `null`.
The value of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.LocalIdKeyIdentifierClause.OwnerType%2A> property is identical to the `ownerType` parameter for the current method.
The value of the `wsu:Id` attribute for an XML element within the current SOAP message.
A that is the type of security token that is referred to by the localId parameter.
`true` if the localId and ownerType parameters match the values of the and properties; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the type of security token that is referred to by the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.LocalIdKeyIdentifierClause.LocalId"></xref> property.
A <xref href="System.Type"></xref> that contains the type of security token that is referred to by the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.LocalIdKeyIdentifierClause.LocalId"></xref> property.
Returns a string that represents the current object.

The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.LocalIdKeyIdentifierClause.ToString%2A> method returns a string that contains the values of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.LocalIdKeyIdentifierClause.LocalId%2A> and <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.LocalIdKeyIdentifierClause.OwnerType%2A> properties.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> that represents the current object.
